main.name: Palaash Kolhe
main.description: at the University of Waterloo. I like to design and program applications that solve problems I notice in the world around me
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.

resume.skillmessage: Some of my skills I have developed working on various projects over the years.

education.degree: Candidate for Bachelors in Software Engineering

work.title: Robotics Lab Attendant
work.description: Volunteered as a robotics lab attendant at the local science centre. I implemented a maze solver with the ROBOTC language in order to teach coding to customers. This was done by utilizing infrared and colour sensors that were attached to the robot.

work.title: President
work.description: I co-founded a club in my high school that aimed to spread coding skills within our community. We did this by creating easy to understand workshops that taught HTML, CSS, and Python. My role in this was coordinating and leading a team of volunteers that would teach these workshops.

projects.title: Shady Assistant
projects.category: A pair of smart glasses that translate foreign language text into English. Implements an OCR script to analyze text and translates with the Google Translate API.

projects.title: Cash Flow Management App
projects.category: An Android App that scans items in receipts using Firebase's OCR model to display spending habits. Categorizes this data and presents in the form of a pie chart.
projects.technologies: Java, Firebase, Android Dev, Machine Learning (OCR)

projects.title: Stock Widget
projects.category: A widget that searches up any stock you want and scrapes relevant information such as live prices, change, dividend yield, etc.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.category: My personal portfolio website created using React. Purely front-end development.

projects.title: Investing with Machine Learning
projects.category: A machine learning powered script that is trained off of stock data spanning all the way back to 2000 to label and predict whether a stock is worth buying.

projects.title: Shopping List App
projects.category: A simple full stack application with a functioning back-end server(express.js, node.js) and database(MongoDB). The front end was created in react.js using the react-strap functionalities.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
